alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Nottoway, northwestern Dinwiddie and southwestern Amelia Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jetersville, or 7 miles west of Amelia Courthouse, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jetersville, Wilsons, Spainville, North Wellville, Earls, Wellville, Maplewood, Fergusonville, Hebron, Deatonville, Clay Store, Denaro and Pattersons Store. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
